00005 """gypd output module
00006 
00007 This module produces gyp input as its output.  Output files are given the
00008 .gypd extension to avoid overwriting the .gyp files that they are generated
00009 from.  Internal references to .gyp files (such as those found in
00010 "dependencies" sections) are not adjusted to point to .gypd files instead;
00011 unlike other paths, which are relative to the .gyp or .gypd file, such paths
00012 are relative to the directory from which gyp was run to create the .gypd file.
00013 
00014 This generator module is intended to be a sample and a debugging aid, hence
00015 the "d" for "debug" in .gypd.  It is useful to inspect the results of the
00016 various merges, expansions, and conditional evaluations performed by gyp
00017 and to see a representation of what would be fed to a generator module.
00018 
00019 It's not advisable to rename .gypd files produced by this module to .gyp,
00020 because they will have all merges, expansions, and evaluations already
00021 performed and the relevant constructs not present in the output; paths to
00022 dependencies may be wrong; and various sections that do not belong in .gyp
00023 files such as such as "included_files" and "*_excluded" will be present.
00024 Output will also be stripped of comments.  This is not intended to be a
00025 general-purpose gyp pretty-printer; for that, you probably just want to
00026 run "pprint.pprint(eval(open('source.gyp').read()))", which will still strip
00027 comments but won't do all of the other things done to this module's output.
00028 
00029 The specific formatting of the output generated by this module is subject
00030 to change.
00031 """
00032 
00033 
00034 import gyp.common
00035 import errno
00036 import os
00037 import pprint
00038 
00039 
00040 # These variables should just be spit back out as variable references.
00041 _generator_identity_variables = [
00042   'CONFIGURATION_NAME',
00043   'EXECUTABLE_PREFIX',
00044   'EXECUTABLE_SUFFIX',
00045   'INTERMEDIATE_DIR',
00046   'LIB_DIR',
00047   'PRODUCT_DIR',
00048   'RULE_INPUT_ROOT',
00049   'RULE_INPUT_DIRNAME',
00050   'RULE_INPUT_EXT',
00051   'RULE_INPUT_NAME',
00052   'RULE_INPUT_PATH',
00053   'SHARED_INTERMEDIATE_DIR',
00054   'SHARED_LIB_DIR',
00055   'SHARED_LIB_PREFIX',
00056   'SHARED_LIB_SUFFIX',
00057   'STATIC_LIB_PREFIX',
00058   'STATIC_LIB_SUFFIX',
00059 ]
00060 
00061 # gypd doesn't define a default value for OS like many other generator
00062 # modules.  Specify "-D OS=whatever" on the command line to provide a value.
00063 generator_default_variables = {
00064 }
00065 
00066 # gypd supports multiple toolsets
00067 generator_supports_multiple_toolsets = True
00068 
00069 # TODO(mark): This always uses <, which isn't right.  The input module should
00070 # notify the generator to tell it which phase it is operating in, and this
00071 # module should use < for the early phase and then switch to > for the late
00072 # phase.  Bonus points for carrying @ back into the output too.
00073 for v in _generator_identity_variables:
00074   generator_default_variables[v] = '<(%s)' % v
00075 
00076 
00077 def GenerateOutput(target_list, target_dicts, data, params):
00078   output_files = {}
00079   for qualified_target in target_list:
00080     [input_file, target] = \
00081         gyp.common.ParseQualifiedTarget(qualified_target)[0:2]
00082 
00083     if input_file[-4:] != '.gyp':
00084       continue
00085     input_file_stem = input_file[:-4]
00086     output_file = input_file_stem + params['options'].suffix + '.gypd'
00087 
00088     if not output_file in output_files:
00089       output_files[output_file] = input_file
00090 
00091   for output_file, input_file in output_files.iteritems():
00092     output = open(output_file, 'w')
00093     pprint.pprint(data[input_file], output)
00094     output.close()
